text: Why regular expression's "non-capturing" group is not working
In my snippet below, the non-capturing group "(?

:aaa)" should be ignored in matching result,
so the result should be "_bbb" only.
However, I get "aaa_bbb" in matching result; only when I specify group(2) does it show "_bbb".

code:
import re

string1 = "aaa_bbb"
print(re.match(r"(?:aaa)(_bbb)", string1).group())

>>> aaa_bbb
